text: Alan Mackay-Sim (16 May 1951 â€“ 4 January 2023) was an Australian biomedical scientist. His research into stem cells lead to the treatment of spinal cord injuries. He was named Australian of the Year in 2017. Mackay-Sim was born in Wahroonga, a suburb of Sydney, New South Wales. He was married and had two children. In 2015, Mackay-Sim was diagnosed with multiple myeloma. He died in January 2023, at the age of 71. ==References== ==Other websites== * Alan Mackay-Sim at Griffith University Category:1951 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Australian medical researchers Category:Order of Australia Category:People from Sydney
title: Alan Mackay-Sim
